column4: hey guys, it's me again.  I'm having more problems with DELUGE
are you on a college campus?
no I'm at home, and never had port forwarding issues till I switched to linucks
it's possible your ISP started to ban p2p traffic
is there a way to find out?
because my ports aren't forwarding like they should, no matter what number i use
have you tried enabling protocol encryption? If I were you I would force encryption upstream and downstream
already ahead of you on that.
are you sure it's not just the torrent you are trying to download?
i GET BETTER SPEEDS ON OTHER TORRENTS, BUT IT STILL SAYS NO CONNECTIONS

I am not sure, I've had this problem before. This is really a silly solution but when I switched to the newest Azureus all my problems went away. I really like Deluge and Azureus is bloated as hell but for some reason Azureus works and Deluge (and other clients) do not
people keep telling me that.  I really hated azureus
I do too, lol. For some reason they have a better encryption scheme or something, I have no idea. It's the only way I can get around my ISP deep packet inspection to torrent
ok, thanks.  I'll give it a go.
go to azureus.com not vuze.com, they made a new stand-alone torrent client
that I think is less bloated than the entire vuze crap
